intro: Astragalus quinquefoliolatus, commonly known as the five-leafed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which typically consist of five leaflets, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or steppe habitats. Astragalus quinquefoliolatus is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
